newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia's Westmont firms in restructuring.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia's Westmont firms in restructuring.

text.p: Malaysia's Westmont Land (Asia) Bhd (Westland) said it plans to acquire a 32.9 percent stake in Westmont Industries Bhd for 421.8 million ringgit through a newly-formed investment holding firm, Newco.

In a restructuring of companies controlled by tycoon Joseph Chong, Newco will first acquire 76.68 million shares representing 32.9 percent equity in Westmont Industries, Westland said in a statement issued by its merchant bankers on Saturday.
Chong's private company, Westmont Holdings Sdn Bhd, is selling its entire stake in Westmont Industries to Westland.
Westmont Holdings also holds a 17.18 percent equity in Westland.
Property, plantations and power firm Westland will then subscribe to 999,998 new shares of Newco for 999,998 ringgit.
Westland will also acquire just two subscriber shares from existing shareholders of Newco for two ringgit.

To pay for the proposed Westmont Industries acquisition by Newco, Westland will issue 23.8 million new shares at 4.0 ringgit each and 326.7 million 4.0 percent irredeemable convertible unsecured loan stocks to Westmont Holdings.
The statement said the restructuring will allow Westland to diversify and enhance its earnings quality.
Westmont Industries is involved in property business and in marine- and oil-related engineering services.
The proposals are subject to approvals from the Foreign Investment Committee, the Securities Commission and shareholders.

Westland shares, which were requoted on Monday after being suspended from Oct 11, were down four cents to 3.72 ringgit at the end of the morning session. Requoted Westmont Industries rose four cents to 4.42 ringgit.
